alert.note: Alert for Yellowstone National Park (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 2:58PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Park and northwestern Teton Counties through 330 PM MDT... At 258 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Harlequin Lake, or near West Yellowstone, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Harlequin Lake around 310 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Madison, Firehole Canyon, Fairy Falls, Gibbons Falls and Fountain Paint Pot. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
